memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2480

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the penal law, in relation to imprisonment for a sex crime
against a minor less than 17 years of age

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section one of the bill adds a new §70.11 to the Penal Law requiring
that a defendant convicted of a sex crime under article 130 of the
Penal Law against a minor less than seventeen years of age shall
impose a sentence of imprisonment in accordance with the applicable
provisions of law.

JUSTIFICATION:
To insure that sex offenders are assured of a minimum sentence
commensurate with their crime.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

PRIOR LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2003-04: Senate Codes Cmte./Assembly Codes Cmte.
2005-06: Senate Codes Cmte./Assembly Codes Cmte.
2007-08: Senate Codes Cmte./Assembly Codes Cmte.
2009-10: Reported and Committed to Senate Finance/Rules Cmtes./
         Assembly Codes Cmte.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeeding
the date on which it shall have become a law.
